 I. [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׁוּר‎</span>] **verb** perhaps ==travel, journey== (Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***šâru***</u></abbr>, ***pass along, take one's way***, Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> (<img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">) ***go, pass along, journey***, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***caravan***, Palmyrene <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שירתא‎</span> [[BDB#Ldzb|Lzb]]<sup>375</sup> [[BDB#Cook|SAC]]<sup>113</sup> [[BDB#Cooke|Cooke]]<sup>271</sup>, Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> (? Arabic loan-word, [[BDB#Frä|Frä]]<sup>180</sup>)); — 

**Qal** ***Imperfect*** 2 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַתָּשֻׁרִי לַמֶּלֶךְ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בַּשֶּׁמֶן‎</span> [[Isa.57.9|Isa 57:9]] ***and thou*** (the apostate faction) ***didst journey to*** (the god) ***Melek with*** (thine) ***oil***, i.e. bring, offer it ([[BDB#Che|Che]] [[BDB#Marti|Marti]] read <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַתָּסֻכִי‎</span>). ***Participle*** feminine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׁרוֺתַיִךְ‎</span> [[Ezek.27.25|Ezek 27:25]] ships of Tarshish were ***thy travellers*** (i.e. traders), but improbable; [[BDB#Krae|Krae]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׁרוֺת לָךְ בְּ‎</span> ***journey for thee*** with thy wares; Toy <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רֹכְלַיִךְ בְּ‎</span>; [[BDB#Co|Co]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ֵשׁרְתוּךְ‎</span> ***served thee***.
